sections.title_template: Vacuum Sealing Meat: The Easy Way to Beat Freezer Burn
Quick Tips for Meat Sealing Success

items.q: How long does vacuum sealed meat last in the freezer?
items.a_template: Well-sealed and kept at 0°F/-18°C or below, most cuts last 1–3 years with quality intact. Always follow safe food storage guidelines.

items.q: Do you need to pre-freeze meat before vacuum sealing?
items.a_template: Not required for whole cuts, but a 30–60 minute chill firms soft pieces and helps avoid juice in the seal area.

items.q: Can you vacuum seal meat with marinade?
items.a_template: Yes—pre-chill to thicken the marinade, or freeze for 30 minutes first. Use 'Moist' or 'Gentle/Pulse' mode to avoid drawing liquid into the seal.
